3471.name: Health expenditure, public (% of government expenditure)
3471.description: Public health expenditure consists of recurrent and capital spending from government (central and local) budgets, external borrowings and grants (including donations from international agencies and nongovernmental organizations), and social (or compulsory) health insurance funds.
3471.s_name: World Bank – WDI: Health expenditure, public (% of government expenditure)

source.name: World Bank – WDI: Health expenditure, public (% of government expenditure)
source.dataPublisherSource: World Health Organization Global Health Expenditure database (see http://apps.who.int/nha/database for the most recent updates).
source.additionalInfo: Notes from original source: All the health expenditure indicators refer to expenditures by financing agent except external resources which is a financing source. When the number is smaller than 0.05%, the percentage may appear as zero. In countries where the fiscal year begins in July, expenditure data have been allocated to the later calendar year (for example, 2010 data will cover the fiscal year 2009–10), unless otherwise stated for the country.
